trans-unit.source: Overview of .NET implementations
trans-unit.target: Overview of .NET implementations

trans-unit.source: .NET Platform is, at its very core, a set of standards that can be implemented.
trans-unit.target: .NET Platform is, at its very core, a set of standards that can be implemented.

trans-unit.source: There are various implementations, some coming from Microsoft, some coming from other companies and groups.
trans-unit.target: There are various implementations, some coming from Microsoft, some coming from other companies and groups.

trans-unit.source: This document will outline the current state of the .NET ecosystem and its various implementations, so you can get a good "lay of the land".
trans-unit.target: This document will outline the current state of the .NET ecosystem and its various implementations, so you can get a good "lay of the land".

trans-unit.source: .NET Core
trans-unit.target: .NET Core

trans-unit.source: .NET Core is a cloud-optimized, cross-platform implementation of the .NET Platform.
trans-unit.target: .NET Core is a cloud-optimized, cross-platform implementation of the .NET Platform.

trans-unit.source: It currently supports three main operating systems: Linux, Windows and OS X.
trans-unit.target: It currently supports three main operating systems: Linux, Windows and OS X.

trans-unit.source: There are several reasons why we built .NET Core.
trans-unit.target: There are several reasons why we built .NET Core.

trans-unit.source: Cross-platform support is a requirement of many developers today.
trans-unit.target: Cross-platform support is a requirement of many developers today.

trans-unit.source: It's important to use the platform that has the characteristics required by the application, which, in turn, can run on the platform required by users or perhaps is prescribed by corporate policy.
trans-unit.target: It's important to use the platform that has the characteristics required by the application, which, in turn, can run on the platform required by users or perhaps is prescribed by corporate policy.

trans-unit.source: For all of these, we need a cross-platform runtime.
trans-unit.target: For all of these, we need a cross-platform runtime.

trans-unit.source: Open Source because it has proven to be the best possible way to enable a larger set of platforms, supported by community contribution.
trans-unit.target: Open Source because it has proven to be the best possible way to enable a larger set of platforms, supported by community contribution.

trans-unit.source: Better packaging story of the entire runtime is also something that influenced the design of the runtime.
trans-unit.target: Better packaging story of the entire runtime is also something that influenced the design of the runtime.

trans-unit.source: We wanted to make sure that the entire runtime can be distributed as a set of pieces that developers can pick and choose from, rather than a single, monolithic platform.
trans-unit.target: We wanted to make sure that the entire runtime can be distributed as a set of pieces that developers can pick and choose from, rather than a single, monolithic platform.

trans-unit.source: .NET Core is the first implementation of .NET Platform that will be distributed via <linkText>NuGet</linkText><title></title> package manager.
trans-unit.target: .NET Core is the first implementation of .NET Platform that will be distributed via <linkText>NuGet</linkText><title></title> package manager.

trans-unit.source: Better isolation and versioning was one of the influencers to create .NET Core.
trans-unit.target: Better isolation and versioning was one of the influencers to create .NET Core.

trans-unit.source: Today's trends in development practices lead to a very different way of developing sofware than what was common even a couple of years ago.
trans-unit.target: Today's trends in development practices lead to a very different way of developing sofware than what was common even a couple of years ago.

trans-unit.source: Cloud services are posed to radically change the way developers build, test and run their solutions.
trans-unit.target: Cloud services are posed to radically change the way developers build, test and run their solutions.

trans-unit.source: Application containers like Docker are introducing new possibilities and opportunities when it comes to server (and services) consolidation.
trans-unit.target: Application containers like Docker are introducing new possibilities and opportunities when it comes to server (and services) consolidation.

trans-unit.source: With this in mind, the .NET Core is targeting scenarios where the application, essentially, "takes" the runtime with it.
trans-unit.target: With this in mind, the .NET Core is targeting scenarios where the application, essentially, "takes" the runtime with it.

trans-unit.source: This allows for per-app versioning scenario; the developer needs to worry only about the runtime (a set of packages, as seen in the previous paragraph) that her app is dependent on.
trans-unit.target: This allows for per-app versioning scenario; the developer needs to worry only about the runtime (a set of packages, as seen in the previous paragraph) that her app is dependent on.

trans-unit.source: With all of the above, .NET Core represents a very generic, cross-platform and modern runtime that is capable of supporting multiple workloads, from cloud services, to desktop applications to CLI tools.
trans-unit.target: With all of the above, .NET Core represents a very generic, cross-platform and modern runtime that is capable of supporting multiple workloads, from cloud services, to desktop applications to CLI tools.

trans-unit.source: .NET Framework
trans-unit.target: .NET Framework

trans-unit.source: The .NET Framework is the premier implemetentation of the .NET Platform available for Windows server and client developers.
trans-unit.target: The .NET Framework is the premier implemetentation of the .NET Platform available for Windows server and client developers.

trans-unit.source: It is a very powerful, very mature framework, with a huge class library (known as the Framework Class Librariries) that supports a wide variety of applications and solutions on Windows.
trans-unit.target: It is a very powerful, very mature framework, with a huge class library (known as the Framework Class Librariries) that supports a wide variety of applications and solutions on Windows.

trans-unit.source: There are additional stacks built on top the .NET Framework that allow developers to build applications ranging from console applications, across rich client (WPF) applications to scalable web applications.
trans-unit.target: There are additional stacks built on top the .NET Framework that allow developers to build applications ranging from console applications, across rich client (WPF) applications to scalable web applications.

trans-unit.source: [Windows Forms](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd30h2yb(v=vs.110).aspx) and [Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms754130(v=vs.110).aspx) are two User Interface (UI) stacks that allow you to build desktop applications for Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: [Windows Forms](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd30h2yb(v=vs.110).aspx) and [Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms754130(v=vs.110).aspx) are two User Interface (UI) stacks that allow you to build desktop applications for Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: Windows Forms' strength is in its rich support for common databinding as well as access to Windows' native user interface controls.
trans-unit.target: Windows Forms' strength is in its rich support for common databinding as well as access to Windows' native user interface controls.

trans-unit.source: WPF, on the other hand, allows you to exercise much more control over the look and feel of your application.
trans-unit.target: WPF, on the other hand, allows you to exercise much more control over the look and feel of your application.

trans-unit.source: Both of them allow for building very rich desktop applications that run on Windows, and you should pick the one that is suited for your use case.
trans-unit.target: Both of them allow for building very rich desktop applications that run on Windows, and you should pick the one that is suited for your use case.

trans-unit.source: [Windows Communication Foundation (WCF)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms731082(v=vs.110).aspx) is a set of libraries that comprise the middleware services stack on .NET Framework.
trans-unit.target: [Windows Communication Foundation (WCF)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms731082(v=vs.110).aspx) is a set of libraries that comprise the middleware services stack on .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: It allows you to create services that can communicate through various supported protocols using various data formats, and that can be hoster in any process you choose.
trans-unit.target: It allows you to create services that can communicate through various supported protocols using various data formats, and that can be hoster in any process you choose.

trans-unit.source: This leads to one of the major features of WCF: your services are not tied to any particular hosting strategy or approach.
trans-unit.target: This leads to one of the major features of WCF: your services are not tied to any particular hosting strategy or approach.

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET is the .NET web framework.
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET is the .NET web framework.

trans-unit.source: Being a very rich framework, it has several distinct pieces which are used to produce modern and high-performance web applications.
trans-unit.target: Being a very rich framework, it has several distinct pieces which are used to produce modern and high-performance web applications.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ASP.NET Web Forms</linkText><title></title> is a set of tools geared primarily towards developer productivity, allowing quick turnaround on web applications with a drag-and-drop surface reusing web controls for everything from loging in to data binding.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ASP.NET Web Forms</linkText><title></title> is a set of tools geared primarily towards developer productivity, allowing quick turnaround on web applications with a drag-and-drop surface reusing web controls for everything from loging in to data binding.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ASP.NET MVC</linkText><title></title> allows for a different approach, one that gives you greater control over the entire pipeline, from HTTP layer to the user interface.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ASP.NET MVC</linkText><title></title> allows for a different approach, one that gives you greater control over the entire pipeline, from HTTP layer to the user interface.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ASP.NET WebAPI</linkText><title></title> is a convention-based framework for creating REST services.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ASP.NET WebAPI</linkText><title></title> is a convention-based framework for creating REST services.

trans-unit.source: It allows you to stand up a REST endpoint extremely fast.
trans-unit.target: It allows you to stand up a REST endpoint extremely fast.

trans-unit.source: Finally, <linkText>SignalR</linkText><title></title> allows you to provide push-based communication to your web applications using <linkText>WebSocket</linkText><title></title> protocol.
trans-unit.target: Finally, <linkText>SignalR</linkText><title></title> allows you to provide push-based communication to your web applications using <linkText>WebSocket</linkText><title></title> protocol.

trans-unit.source: .NET Native
trans-unit.target: .NET Native

trans-unit.source: .NET Native is not so much an "edition" of the .NET platform as it is a set of tools that allow developers to have different build outputs.
trans-unit.target: .NET Native is not so much an "edition" of the .NET platform as it is a set of tools that allow developers to have different build outputs.

trans-unit.source: The normal .NET source compilation process takes the source code written in one of the .NET languages (such as C\#, Visual Basic, F\# etc.)
trans-unit.target: The normal .NET source compilation process takes the source code written in one of the .NET languages (such as C\#, Visual Basic, F\# etc.)

trans-unit.source: and produces something called "Intermediate Language".
trans-unit.target: and produces something called "Intermediate Language".

trans-unit.source: IL is then picked up by the runtime, and Just-In-Time compiled at run-time to machine code.
trans-unit.target: IL is then picked up by the runtime, and Just-In-Time compiled at run-time to machine code.

trans-unit.source: .NET Native is an additional step in this pipeline which takes the IL and compiles it Ahead-of-Time (AOT) to machine code, so that when the code is executed, there is only "native" code running.
trans-unit.target: .NET Native is an additional step in this pipeline which takes the IL and compiles it Ahead-of-Time (AOT) to machine code, so that when the code is executed, there is only "native" code running.

trans-unit.source: This means that the resulting binary is what the OS executes; there is no JIT-ing, no runtime compilation.
trans-unit.target: This means that the resulting binary is what the OS executes; there is no JIT-ing, no runtime compilation.

trans-unit.source: This leads to better performance, as well as some security benefits.
trans-unit.target: This leads to better performance, as well as some security benefits.

trans-unit.source: .NET Native is the set of tools used to build .NET Universal Windows Platform (UWP) applications.
trans-unit.target: .NET Native is the set of tools used to build .NET Universal Windows Platform (UWP) applications.

trans-unit.source: Supported operating systems
trans-unit.target: Supported operating systems

trans-unit.source: .NET Framework is supported only on Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: .NET Framework is supported only on Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: .NET Native is, at this time, supported only on Windows.
trans-unit.target: .NET Native is, at this time, supported only on Windows.

trans-unit.source: .NET Core is supported on Windows, Linux and OS X.
trans-unit.target: .NET Core is supported on Windows, Linux and OS X.
